website_summaries.verdict: The Canon Pixma MP560 multifunction printer and its flashy 2-inch LCD screen and auto-document feeder may seem appealing at first, but the average consumer will find that Lexmark's Impact S305 offers faster performance and higher quality results for $50 less.
cons: competition offers better image quality for less

customer_reviews.title: I've had this printer for apx 7 years and I've loved it all this time
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for apx 7 years and I've loved it all this time. Easy, reliable. I've had a lot of printers, and I've worked in IT for 20 years, and have had to deal with a lot of printers. They're usually a major pain. This one has been a pleasure! Also, if you get photo paper and use it for printing photos, the quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: CasieJean

customer_reviews.title: How do printers still have so much trouble connecting to Wifi??
customer_reviews.text: This was a decent printer, it finally crapped out after nearly 10 years with the LCD screen dying out. It was a constant pain though while owning it, I had to very, very regularly either spend an eternity trying to reconnect the printer through network to my laptop, or just use my USB cable to manually connect and print. Very frustrating to use, but it did print with good quality and did last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: dan60150

customer_reviews.title: Good workhorse with flaws
customer_reviews.text: Used this for 8 years, mostly reliable, but had to replace print head a few years ago. In the past few years, it also developed a intermittent paper handling problem that no amount of cleaning would fix. Scanner worked fine, duplex worked reliably, and included Canon software was easy to use. I might or might not replace it with another Canon.
customer_reviews.author: R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: 9 Years and still kicking ass!
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of my best investments, like the tittle says I've had it for 9 years and it has never let me down, has NEVER needed repair! ! Not to mention I bought it for 98 bucks!!! The printer quality is exceptional, specially for pictures! I LOVE this this printer all around!
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Semorile

customer_reviews.title: 3 Year Life
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable printer while it lasted. Was used almost 5 days a week - only 3 to 7 pages a day on average. Drinks ink, ... but the generics work okay, so cost is somewhat controlled. Reasonably quiet, decent speed for printing and copying. Scans are fine and directly load into your email. Began misbehaving before its 3rd birthday (post-'terrible twos') - gave error messages requiring turning off the printer. Worked intermittently for a few weeks before finally refusing to print or copy at all. "Died" on its 3rd anniversary, to the very day. I have a large stock of ink (CLI, PGI) for it - if anyone will pay the shipping, they can have it for free.
customer_reviews.author: Aerospace Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Deadline 12 months
customer_reviews.text: A great printer for the $, too bad after 13 months the print head crashed and the tech support said it would cost more to fix than I paid for it! Seems everything nowadays last a year then is pre-manufactured or programmed to be useless. That's why I went out and bought a cheaper version of this printer. Bad enough paying outrageous prices on ink, didn't last long enough to use up what I had bought! When it worked it worked beautifully though!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Cheap printer - Expensive ink scheme
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a scam. All cheap printers are scams. The printer will not work (even in scan mode) if even one ink cartridge is missing. You can't even print black and white if you're missing a yellow cartridge even if you're full on black ink. A full set of cartridges is about $45 which is almost half the cost of the printer. Good job Canon, you've tricked me into being your consumer whore. On the bright side, most prints and scan quality was good enough for me and it has held up for a number of years. The printer also has a cheap initial cost ($100 on sale).
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: Initial Review - Mac and Window Home
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up as a lightning deal, so the price was very attractive. We have a mixed network of Windows and Macs - all running though Airport Extreme. Setup of the WIFI was quite easy. Connecting the Mac was easy because I followed the instructions given by a previous reviewer, and just downloaded the files directly from Canon. On the Windows machines, I ended up downloading files also, because the program on the disk kept crashing. Connection was fairly easy and straight forward. All machines can print anywhre in the house, and I can scan back via WIFI. Have not used the printer but a week, but work very well so far. Will report back after a month and update.
customer_reviews.author: Bronz_Mdl

customer_reviews.title: From "Hassled Daily" to "Hassle Free"
customer_reviews.text: My HP went the way of the wind with Vista. Nice of them to leave us high and dry.... offering no software updates...sharing "tricks" on how to use the scanner. Oh well. I'm glad. It was sucking the ink out of me. What a jewel this Canon printer is. And this was my first wireless set-up ever. I bought the cable expecting I would not be able to pull off the wireless part. Didn't need it. Photos: Wow +++++ Crop and print... very nice! Touchless Duplex Feature: Two sided printing without having to reload. Wireless!!! Hidden Paper tray. Seperate ink color wells. Flawless, quick set-up. Quality performance. Office capable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Canon all-in-ones i've had
customer_reviews.text: Replacing my Lexmark X75 All-in-one, I bought this for under $100 at amazon, impressed with the features, price and wireless capability. I've had it for about a year now, and it's given me few problems. - SD card, USB slot for inserting flash drive, easy to use LCD-display. - Wireless setup was easy and painless. - Prints beautiful, high quality photos on photo paper One big con is that it seems to refuse to SCAN if there is no ink, or if ink levels are running low. I found this very odd. Even so, it's not that big of a con because I always purchase refurbished, cheaper ink packs here on amazon instead of purchasing them straight from canon.
customer_reviews.author: Electric Moonlight

customer_reviews.title: The best, most long-lasting printer I've ever bought for my home business.
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this several years ago and am only now leaving a review. It's held up like a champ, and I use it many times a week in my home business. Before I bought this printer, it seemed I was basically buying "disposable printers," because I wound up having to throw them away after only months of use. Not my Canon. It's been so great and worry-free that when I'm ready at some point to upgrade to a new printer, it'll be a Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: One Year and Dead
customer_reviews.text: I have bought nothing but canon printers for many years and was pleased with this mp560 until it gave me the b200 error.....While it worked it did a good job.........What this error seems to mean is the printhead is dead, 1 year old and the printhead (seems to me anyway) designed to die. Not only does the printer die, the scanner also dies.... SO I have a big silver and black paperweight.... I cannot see how this couldn't be by design, are we to the point that a printer only last one year........So now I have to buy some other brand of printer, I can't see buying another canon if this is what to expect.....
customer_reviews.author: Ardan

customer_reviews.title: I was printing in less than 10 mins after unpacking !
customer_reviews.text: Great Printer ! Wireless Setup: -It took less than 10 minutes to set up the printer ! -It automatically found my wireless router, I enetered the key and its done. -Insert software CD. All you really need are the drivers. Takes 2 minutes to install. If you want the utilities and extras, add 5 mins) - Printed test page from laptop without any problems. - Great setup for novice users who don't want to get all tecche. Print Quality: -Print quality is great. -You have to use the good paper. Ink bleeds through on cheap photocopier paper, but all printers do that. -Duplex (2 sided) printing works well too. -Reasonable noise and vibration level.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: I am still using this today for Printing and Envelopes.
customer_reviews.text: This printer has worked great right up through OS X 10.8.2. I have envelopes in the rear tray and use address book to print them. That is rather nice changing colors and fonts. The cassette holds that mid cotton quality for the needs of certain printing needs. It works well. The ink on Amazon and some other third party sellers have worked very well for me for what 2 plus years now. Maybe someday soon an update but the Canon is still putting a great job and this is by Wireless G 2.4
customer_reviews.author: The Thriftier Person

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: It's expensive when compared to other printers but so user friendly That I bought another when my first went down after 10 years! Nice photos too.
customer_reviews.author: CS5

customer_reviews.title: My favorite printer!
customer_reviews.text: I could find this printer nowhere except Amazon! My old one broke and was lucky enough to find a new one. Amazon made mt day!
customer_reviews.author: Addy

customer_reviews.title: printer
customer_reviews.text: this one replaced my old one that quit working. So glad I could still get it.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Seyller

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to the new generation of printers!
customer_reviews.text: Pros * holds 2 black ink cartridges * lights up INSIDE the printer when new ink is loaded properly. (INSIDE of the printer, this is definitely cool) * easy set up (took me a couple of minutes to realize I had to take the large orange plastic caps off of the ink). * USB cord or wifi compatible * smaller size than most printers * loads paper from the front (so you don't have to have paper hanging from the back of the printer) * looks awesome (chrome and shiny black) * scans well * user-friendly overall, it's the best printer I've ever owned! very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Forever Neil

customer_reviews.title: Very flawed printer
customer_reviews.text: This product is deeply flawed. The bluetooth connectivity drops for unexplained reasons, even when my Macbook Pro is 2 inches from the printer. Bluetooth works about 25% of the time, and mysteriously decides not to work about 75% of the time. Scanning to the computer is also problematic. The USB connection is buggy and sometimes gets trapped in a loop where it keeps sending you back to the same step over and over. Very slow printing. This has the feel of a beta, not a finished product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: simply a great printer (for a mac, too)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this printer to replace a much larger Canon that I could never manage to make wireless. This printer is awesome. It was so easy to set up (I have a Mac) and has all the features I want/need; it copies, scans, prints photos, and, most importantly, it does it all wirelessly. The pictures I have printed have come out great. I was able to scan a few documents already without any hassle at all. I actually love the pop up display thing on the side. Really, this printer is just incredibly easy to set up and use. And, for the price, it's unbeatable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: Printer Like New!
customer_reviews.text: Very Pleased with the Printer, Works Perfectly, would Do Business with this Company Again!
customer_reviews.author: Fern Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, but high ink use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for 7 months, and have been pleased overall: - wireless connection is great - double-sided printer is a fantastic feature - quiet - easy set up - nice looking and features are pretty easy to use - great price on Amazon. However: - I find it uses a lot of ink. I don't print photos, and mostly print occasional pages from the web on draft setting, letters or resumes but the black cartridge is already empty, and magenta almost gone. This seems like more usage than my old HP all-in-one. - software to manage and edit scanned pages is OK, but could be more user-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Je dis

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer is really good it has so many features and things you can do with it - its amazing. I gave it 2 starts for ease of use because the manual totally sucks and i've had to email canon on how to do simple things like double sided printing and getting it to print web pages in only black and white. But once you figure it out its great. I haven't had it long enough to give accurate feedback on the ink usage but from everything else I would recommend it for the price. ps (I took back the kodak ESP 7250 before getting this one and its night and day)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very good - except for auto tray select
customer_reviews.text: Good: -print quality -print speed -less bloatware and invasive software than other printer manufactures -scan quality -value -2 print trays; plain paper and a rear one with a straighter paper path Bad: -auto tray select doesn't work very well Most of my printing is done on plain paper, but occasionally I need to use the straighter path rear tray (photos, cd labels, etc). The auto tray select has never worked correctly. I have to go into the printers setting and manually switch between the two paper trays.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Some Faults
customer_reviews.text: Great product - ink is pretty cheap, quality is good, it does everything scan, print, photo, copy etc. One problem i have learned/noticed. You cannot Scan if your out of ink and i cannot find a way to circumvent it. This is really annoying as i just ran out of ink and am moving and just need to scan and send some documents. BUT i CANT because the damn thing wont let me do anything until i replace the ink. I have tried taking the ink out, and putting it back in and just leaving it out. no matter what it wont let me scan before i buy ink which is pretty stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Best home wireless printer/scanner imaginable
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this for about two years and it has been a dream. I love that all the ink colors are separately replaceable to reduce waste. Scanning a document or photo is easy -- I just open the built in Image Capture app on my Mac, put the document in, and click Scan -- all using our wireless network (no USB required). The printer is in a separate room and we just print to it over our wireless network -- never any problems. Printing is high quality and it doesn't seem to use too much ink. Would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: tedhh

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the ease of setup and use. The printer setup went very smoothly from installing the inkjet cartridges to setting up the wireless activation. So far this printer has worked flawlessly and has great print quality for an inkjet. So far no paper jams like I've experienced in past printers, but its too early to tell until the rollers start wearing out. I like the idea of just replacing the individual color cartridges rather than having to throw the entire color cartridge and wasting the unused colors. I bought 2 of them and are satisfied with both. Would definitely recommend this one to friends in the market for a wireless multifunction inkjet.
customer_reviews.author: rye

customer_reviews.title: I had the canon ip4500 and really liked the picture quality so I purchased another canon
customer_reviews.text: I had the canon ip4500 and really liked the picture quality so I purchased another canon. I went with the MP560 (it was new and only $89) but I had problems with it every step of the way and of course every time I sent it out for repair the other canon gave me problems. Now I wanted to replace it with a new MP560 only because I have so much ink left and the price is $362. Someone is craaaazy. Not me, I went for the MX922. It's only $99 and has everything I'm looking for. Fingers crossed it lasts at least a year.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and Easy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer and so easy to set up. Someone was complaining about the password needing to be in all caps... don't know what he was talking about. My network password is all lowercase and has numbers and symbols in it. This printer accommodates the lowercase letters plus all the symbols. It was recognized wirelessly instantaneously by my Windows 7 PC, and I was up and printing wirelessly within 30 minutes of taking it out of the box. Also works great with iphone too. Instant pics from anywhere in the house. Love it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Benegesserit

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer. It prints good quality photos on Canon Photo Paper Plus Glossy II and also Staples Photo Plus Glossy Paper (which is less expensive). The only problem I have had printing pics is with greens. I have found that if the green in the photo is not a bright green, I have to saturate the green in the photo to get a nice print. The printer is a little slow when printing but very quiet. I have found that Amazon has the best price on the ink cartridges. I print all my own photos now--even the ones I sell.
customer_reviews.author: S. Green

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I can say that Im very happy with this printer. The wireless works great and the print quality is very good. Havent used the scanner much but seems to work good. I cant say much about how many print pages per cartridge as I havent had to replace them todate. I replaced a HP printer that gave me much trouble with the wireless connection and this one is MUCH better. BTW, I trashed a HP printer after less than 6 months of use. I do not tolerate products that create problems when using them. I have no question that this printer will give me good results for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bmccombs

customer_reviews.title: This is the third Canon all in one printer I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Canon all in one printer I purchased - and the last. The first lasted 8 years, the second 6 years. Both quit when power supply died. No local repair and repair would cost more than new. Ditto #3, but only lasted 2+ years. Same problem with repair. Now I switched to Epson. Also because they use individual cartridges. NEVER HP!
customer_reviews.author: slh53041

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. Easy to set up, I now have 2 Wi-Fi and 1 UBS connections. I have owned a lot of printers and this one is really slick. It has easy step by step instructions, The ink cartridges light up red when installed It seemed to love my new Windows 7 operating system. Sleek style, medium small foot print. The control center is so easy to use. Print tray opens automatically, no need to get up from your PC. Hands down the best printer I've purchased to date.
customer_reviews.author: tailu66

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a month now and love everything about it, other than the software that it installed which is mildly annoying because I have to close it everytime my computer starts. The printer works fabulously, looks great, is very compact, and has great wireless signal, and was a breeze to setup. It prints beautiful pictures with ease, it scans in a simple to understand manner, and is just generally a joy to work with. The large scale printers at work could learn a lot from this simple little machine.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great all in one printer
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Was reallly easy to set up and learn to use. Makes good copies. Haven't scanned anything yet so don't know about that. A little noisy ( I don't care ). And takes awhile to "think" before it prints but all in all I am happy with it. Looks good too. Much sleeker than my old clunker. One concern - I was fiddling with holder on the lower paper tray and ended up with this little tiny spring! Can't figure out where it came from and hope it doesn't cause problems in the future! Anybody knows - let me know!
customer_reviews.author: reddog mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer, manual needs updating
customer_reviews.text: I received this printer today, and it is working fine. Just a few notes on setup: * It is not obvious how the print head goes in. Look at the picture _very_ carefully. No force is required! * Windows 7 has been out long enough for it to be mentioned in the manual. * The wireless passphrase, for some reason, is entered backwards. If your passphrase is abcd, you would enter dcba for it to appear correctly in the display. All minor things, I'm just trying to save others a few minutes of head scratching.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Giese

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little printer. I set it up wirelessly in very little time, very smooth process, excellent manual with very informative pictures to guide you through the process. The print quality for documents is very good. The only drawback, so far, is that photographic prints show very orange flesh tones, exactly what was reported by professional reviewers. I would not use this printer to print photographs for this reason. However, I did not buy it for that, I needed a good, economical printer with good print quality for documents and this printer fits that need perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: NSM in NC

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: The problem with these reviews are that they send them to be filled out before you have a chance to see how the item will perform in a few months. Regardless, it seems to work really well. I just can't seem to figure out how to set it up for the double sided printing, which was one of the reasons I bought it. I really like how you can close up the entire thing when not in use so it becomes this closed shell. No dust gets in it that way, so imagine that's good for the long run. I'm happy I got this one :)
customer_reviews.author: M. Obadiah

customer_reviews.title: CANON PIXMA PHOTO PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I can't give a decent review of this printer because I bought it on the advice of one of my daughter's and since my other daughter was starting a new business I gave the Canon Photo Printer to her to help her with her business. I have always like Canon products having used their cameras for years. This printer sounded like a wonderful new creation from Canon and AMAZON had a very good price point on my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DESAFIA

customer_reviews.title: Great as a bluetooth printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer is easy to set up. Purchased with the bluetooth option. The printer works effortlessly with the bluetooth connection (small dongle that fits in the bottom front of the printer) but willl not scan this way. The only way you can scan is with the usb wired connection, or with the wireless connection. Software sets up well, but tries to scan using the bluetooth giving errors not warnings. Altogether though, it is a good printer and, as a printer, produces good results.
customer_reviews.author: George Blais

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a cartoonist, and use this printer to print blue-lines on heavy bristol board. The printer handles everything like a champ, great resolution, and can feed up to legal size board through it's rear manual feed. The scanner is not the best in the world, but it's comparable to most 3-in-1's. Plus the wireless function is great. It's not the fastest printer in the world, so I wouldn't buy it if that's what you're looking for; but for high-quality limited use at a low price, this is a great value. Very pleased with the quality of the printer in general!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Harbin

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye HP, Canon Won Me Over
customer_reviews.text: I've been a loyal HP all-in-one user for years, but they seemed to gradually lose quality withe each new model I purchased. My last one was noisy, jammed, and liked to grab 2 sheets at time. I decided to try the Canon PIXMA MP560 and I've not been disappointed. It's faster, quieter, and has a much sleeker appearance. I haven't compared amount of pages/toner, but I'm resigned to the fact that toner cartridges are a rip-off no matter who you buy from. The print quality is excellent, as good as I expect with inkjet.
customer_reviews.author: mpatton

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for Price
customer_reviews.text: I was initially looking for just a scanner when I came across this "all-in-one" unit. The setup to the wireless was easy; the installation was easy; the print quality is very good. The 5 separate ink cartridges had me worried at first but if you get non-OEM replacements, the cost is a little over $1.00/cartridge. For what I am using it for, it is great. Also, there is an APP on the iPhone which will allow you to print from the iPhone directly to the printer, wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: JEL

customer_reviews.title: Grindingly slow
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I've had such a slow printer since the 80's. Hit "Print" and the printer needs a good 90 seconds to go through the motions to print a simple b/w document. What's going on in there--it's pretty noisy. Photos are just okay, nothing to put in a frame or a scrapbook. When the warning light comes on about low-ink, chances are you have 100 pages worth of printing left. Don't bother to change inks until you see the result on the paper.
customer_reviews.author: NYer family

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up, Compact, Wireless, Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this printer. Has almost everything that I want and is compact! Great features with duplexing. Scans and prints nicely (haven't used the faxed yet). Only one Con: (maybe I haven't figured it out yet) I can't feed multiple documents to "Scan" and have to put each document on the flat bed. Again, not sure if I am missing something. So, if this is important to you, just check into it. I am still pleased with my purchase and hope I am mistaken with the Scan issue.
customer_reviews.author: Smile With Sandra

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRINTER !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS WIRELESS PRINTER! I had hesitated about buying this pinter at first but I have been plesantly surprized at what a great printer this is. I've owned it now for about a year. I've linked it to a Belkin router and a Dell Laptop. Later on I replaced the Belkin with a Verizon Wireless MiFi 2200. We take it on the road in our 5th wheel RV. It is user frendly and my wife finds it easy to make copies. The few times that I actually printed pictures, they came out beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: My favorite all time printer
customer_reviews.text: My favorite all time printer. Would have given a five star except the power supply (I think) just blew out (after 5 years). I notice the price on it is now about $460, which surely is a mistake. I got the exact same one for $79.95 and other sites have it for under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Calamity

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer very much. I really like the door that closes on the tray and the control panel. Keeps the dust out! It opens automatically when you ask it to print. I had some difficulty with setup - I have a mac and my disk drive is inoperable (thank you children!) So I had to go to the Cannon website and download the drivers. It was NOT easy AT ALL. Also, I have had a couple of crashes while trying to print from firefox. Lastly, I haven't figured out how to make it print "draft" or "economical" The color is great. The speed of printing is great. It is sleek and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: DanaVH

customer_reviews.title: Good midrange printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for over a month now. It doesn't get used daily but often enough. Ink usage seems to be low compared to what I have read about a lot of other printers in this class. The wireless setup was fairly easy and has worked perfeclty. It's not the fastest printer especially when doing two sided but fast enough for home use. Quality has been excellent. So far it has been one of the best inkjet printers i have owned which were mostly HP.
customer_reviews.author: W. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MP560 Printer
customer_reviews.text: My other Canon MP510 quite printing properly after 4 years of use by the grandkids. I spent $100 on replacement parts trying to fix it and realized this is a throw away product like TV's. I really liked the Pixma line but they keep changing and the local stores did not carry anything less than an 800 series now, so I was gald to find the MP560 available through Amazon as it fits our needs just fine. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: great price for printer
customer_reviews.text: The price of this printer was excellent. I have no experience with setting up any type of computer system, so when I began thus task, I thought I would need to call someone to do this for me. Time it took me was 2 hours, but I had no idea how to set up the wireless system. Although it took me longer than most, I did it on my own and it has worked out very well. The color is great. Printing is slow, but when I think of the cost of the printer, it makes it ok.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen N. Sarlo

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was kinda waiting on this printer to go on a real sale and then I bought it. Glad I did. I am fairly technically literate and did fine with setting up the wireless connection, however I don't think it would be easy for a novice. Prints fine, not very fast but fine for the price. The scanning feature has been good. My sister has the same one and says the ink does go through fairly quickly but as I don't even print one page a week, I think I'll bee fine.
customer_reviews.author: Buttercup

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, space saving, installs easily and does everything great
customer_reviews.text: Got this combo unit to replace the printer and scanner I had. Technology surely improved. Both scanning and printing quality and speed are better then my old separate setup. Needed to buy a longer USB cable. And the inks price are very reasonable when using a 3rd party brand. Installs easily but do download the new driver from the website and not the one on the cd. Glad that I bought it. Can't comment on if it beats Dell 940 or not because I've never used the Dell, and can't compare em.
customer_reviews.author: Deal Hunting Cow

customer_reviews.title: Stable for over a year now...
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these in my two story house to support three wireless laptop users. I replaced HP printers that were constantly losing there wireless connection or needed to be re-configured frequently. These units have been stable for over a year now. Easy to use, wireless hookup is a snap (multiple options) and very cheap ink is available on Amazon. Whats not to like? I was a dire hard HP user before these.....not any more.
customer_reviews.author: SeekingValue

customer_reviews.title: third time is the charm
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about the purchase of another Canon printer, our third printer, in 18 months. The other 2 had problems with the paper feed and also giving us an error message indicating a paper jam. We have never been able to confirm this jam, the printer has stopped functioning all together. Even after calls to customer service...a new printer had to be purchased. It was more than frustrating to have the same problems,with 2 separate models, making me suspicious it would occur again. This printer has worked great so far, and we have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could print from my ipod
customer_reviews.text: The new HP computers allow you to print directly from your iPod. While this printer does quite a bit, ink doesnt last THAT long and its not cheap either. Printer now in days are pretty affordable, I got this for around 85 so you get what you pay for. It gets jammed sometimes, ink is sometimes smudgy, scanned documents scan halfway and scanning isnt fast. This product is also pretty heavy and bulky so be aware of that and where you're going to put it
customer_reviews.author: ark

customer_reviews.title: Great All-In-one at a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I ran out of ink on my older Epson All-in-One and when I went to buy the new ink cartridges, I found it more economical to just buy a brand new printer. I own a Mac so my choices were a bit limited however, this Canon All-In-One printer is bar far the best choice that was out there at the time. Great price, great features, network capabilities (very easy to setup by the way with my mac), print qualities and best of all Free Shipping! How could you lose? I highly recommend this product to anyone who requires scanning, copying and printing at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Notarangelo

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I had a HP office jet printer before this and was very unhappy with it. I decided to try this printer. I dont know if my expectations were low (I dont think so). This printer has exceeded all my expectations so far. Photo prints are great. SW is easy and friendly to use. Have had no issues setting it up or using it. I can print from computer, scan to computer, scan to USB, scan from computer, all using wireless. Have nothing but good things to say about this printer.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jain

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MP560 Wireless Printer
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how it compares to other printers but it does better than a Kodak ESP 7. The 7 was just a heap of trouble, bought it on account of the ink cost comparison which didn't come to play once the print head failed. The 560 is really friendly, set up was easy, printing docs was pretty nice and even tried out a picture, which it delivered without trouble. I always like canon gear, I think from now on, I'll stick.
customer_reviews.author: Bitterman

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: This printer replaced an HP all in one Unit which was having problems with my Mac. You can't go wrong with a Canon! The setup was decent, not earth-shatteringly easy. The included software leaves a small footprint, which stands in stark contrast to HP. Network setup is easy. The scroll wheel interface isn't my favorite, but not bad either. I recommend technology purchases to family and friends - this one will be on my list of good buys.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Danner

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressive
customer_reviews.text: The ink started clogging not too long after using it.
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -shipped in one day while I had two day shipping -wireless -easy to set up, if you follow the directions word for word (note: I have a mac and followed the Canon directions, not the ones left by a previous reviewer, and I had no issues!) -great product, especially for the price -photo printing -the price! Cons: -it's pretty large, but that's not a huge deal -it's not the fastest printer, but that's also not a huge deal either I would recommend this product to others! You really can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Finally moved away from Hp
customer_reviews.text: After years of buying and replacing Hp all in one's, I've finally settled on a Printer/Scanner I really like. There is nothing about the mp560 that feels cheap. Real nice design. Clear interface. WiFi and a neat ink replacement system that, when you open to lid, blinks to let you know which cartridge to replace. I have had this model for almost a year and can not find anything wrong with it. I don't typically review my purchases. But I thought I should help simplify someones decision if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer, fits my small space, and has some nice touches like the drawer opening automatically and closing nicely -- almost assisted, like a car door. Having said that I can't get duplex to work well with my Mac on a consistent basis. I think it's a setting, but the network scan feature works with the Mac and it's a good printer overall for the price. Can't judge on the ink usage yet. I'll just accept it. I'm not photo printing or anything. I looked a while and if you can get this on a deal or discount, get it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Have had this printer for about a month. Setup was very easy on a Dell Windows 7 laptop, wireless connection worked right away. Love the auto duplex printing: saves lots of paper. I like the fact that there are separate cartridges for each color, this should save money on ink also (printer rated as one of cheapest to operate on several computer magazine sites). It is compact, fairly quiet and starts printing right away when you select print from an app(my dell V313W had an aggravating delay)Print quality is quite good but I do NOT do photos, but as an everyday home printer I would highly recommned this printer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hough

customer_reviews.title: Love This Printer
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this all-in-one to replace a Canon scanner that had no Win 7 drivers. Perfectly good scanner...what a waste. At any rate, I love this little gadget. I like the convenience of being wireless and I love the fact that it has separate ink tanks. It was simple to set up and it's quick and quiet. Scanner does a good job for my everyday scanning tasks. That's why I've been a faithful Canon owner for over a decade.
customer_reviews.author: Purple'puter Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great printer.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I think you'd have a difficult time finding a better printer. Took it out of the box, set it up, loaded the software, and printed a test page in less than 30 minutes. Made a great present for my girlfriend, and she was able to begin printing, without having to read a manual. She loves it! She was very impressed by the speed. Having had a very slow inkjet previously she was very impressed when the printed piece came out of the printer like a laser printer, or copier (no jerky one line at a time creeping out of the printer, and waiting).
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: I trusted the reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews for this printer. I trusted the reviews for this printer. I am glad that I did. The printer is everything that I expected. I am pleased as punch with this printer. The instructs are perfect. The setup was easy. It is easy to print (via WiFi). It is easy to scan. The quality is outstanding. I can't believe that one can buy a product this good for a price this low. Trust the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C. Laughton

customer_reviews.title: Solid printer
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer. It is pretty much as advertised. The LCD screen is nice. The bottom paper feed is nice as well. I certainly wish it had a feeder for scanning and faxing purposes, but it is hard to complain about the price. The printing is pretty fast once the printer warms up (which does take a bit) and is very nice. Unlike other wireless printers I have add, the setup was a breeze with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say..Real great printer..bought this last week and I love it..Setting up was kinda easy. Loving it each day..I didn't know it worked with 5 inks..If I had known I wouldn't buy it but it aight still. Would recommend buying this anytime....Print quality is great as usual with all canon printers and at first I didn't know where the papers should go and found it they have to go in tray underneath the printer..Its nice..
customer_reviews.author: Meeka

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this printer
customer_reviews.text: I went to the Canon web site and downloaded the latest driver and software for Vista and this printer works flawlessly. It does everything I need it to do and ink usage is minimal. Wireless works great from another room. I am completely satisfied with this purchase. I never opened the instructions, just installed the ink and set up wireless and have been using it since. Best all in one printer I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Pa.

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer and Scanner
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement of my old Canon i550 printer which finally stopped working after a few months of trouble. I was worried that this printer would be more complex to use since it had more buttons that my last printer, but works pretty much the same. I've found little difference in the on screen menus. Using the printer without the computer seem fairly easy from what I've used it. The quality of the scans and the printouts are great. The only thing that I don't like about it is that it doesn't turn on automatically when the computer needs it as did my old printer, but that not a huge problem, just something to get use to.
customer_reviews.author: Evrine

customer_reviews.title: Budget Wireless printing for family
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this printer for almost 2yrs and it's the best printer I've bought so far. No problems so far with printing/scanning/copying. Best feature, wireless printing! Really good at picking up wireless signal. I've mine ~30ft away from a Wireless-N router and it never failed in printing a document. I mostly print documents using this. So, I've never tried the photo printing feature of it. Still, highly recommend this AIO to anyone that's looking for a budget AIO printer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't used it much yet, I am very impressed with this printer thus far. The wireless set-up was very easy and I was up and running inside of twenty minutes. I'm switching from an HP specifically for the wireless capability; I didn't go with the wireless HP because I wasn't completely satisfied with the one that I have. For the ease of use and all of the available features, you just can't beat it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh S. Murray

customer_reviews.title: nice pics
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice printer. It does beautiful pics. It works great for about a year of light duty then things start to go wrong. Usually it can be fixed or it's ink related and a thorough cleaning will help but after a while you are spending too much time on maintenance, way too much. so you throw it away and get a new one... Is that what they intended?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a wireless printer and my mom had this one but not the wireless version. I think this printer is great. Sometimes it take a few moments to send the document to the printer but besides that it works great. I've had no problems with this printer and it was easy to set up. I use my laptop in my living room so I put the printer in a cabinet in my entertainment center and I just flip it open when I need to print. It's very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Staci David

customer_reviews.title: Great little wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: For the price that I paid ($149), I am quite pleased. I see that the same printer is now $249...easy set-up, works super with my Linksys Cisco E4200 Wireless, I basically use the copier and scanner and rate both excellent for the price range. The ink cartridges are average, $$ and time they last. Overall, a good investment....updated the drivers to Windows 7, a little hassle, but got it to work. The My Image Garden download is nice....thats it
customer_reviews.author: Serenitysdad

customer_reviews.title: Canon Wireless Printer
customer_reviews.text: I boght an equivlant HP but couldn't never get it to start, I called Tech support and they told me after hours on the phone that the printer was defective and they will send me a replacement a recondionted one. I took back to store and got the canon. I was very happy with this printer, I have it conected through a wireless network and it is easy to use, fast with great printing results.
customer_reviews.author: Nabil El-Antably

customer_reviews.title: Good Bang For The Buck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an irritating HP 7160. The only thing that the HP did I liked better is it spit the pages out in order, printing backwards. The Canon wins in all other categories. This printer is not aggravating to use at all. No printer is good on ink and none deserve a 5 because of this. How many of us have tossed cartridges in the trash before they were actually empty?
customer_reviews.author: David A. Stout

customer_reviews.title: Five year useful life
customer_reviews.text: Ours had a five year life span from August 2010 to Feb 2015 which I guess isn't too bad for a printer. However, this was very lightly used, and had to reinstall software a lot. Ink was pretty expensive to replace. Just ok, not that great. Going for laser this time.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: a first-rate product
customer_reviews.text: Canon does it again. This is a fantastic unit for a home office. Print quality is excellent and the 600 dpi scanner works like a charm. Setup was easy, it found my wireless network right away. I love that I can place this unit anywhere I have power rather than tethering it to my PC. Canon inks are reasonably priced too, you can get the 5 cartidge set for just north of $40 at Costco.
customer_reviews.author: Da Moogs

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer - buy with confidence
customer_reviews.text: I have no affiliation with Canon. Bot this printer because I HAD to have a wireless printer that was decent and it does not disappoint. I have Verizon Fios Internet and the printer easily connected with the router. It was easy to set up the other laptops in the house. The photo print quality is fine for my scrapbook needs. The flatbed copier is just what I needed. Everything about the printer is easy / intuitive. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: For my application, this printer has good utility. I sell on eBay and need a good scanner and printer which this product posesses. I do not want wires running everywhere so I like the wireless feature also. The by-pass tray is a plus becauce I can use it to print envelopes. Like all ink-jet printers, the cost of the ink is inflated. I don't know why they just don't give us the printers because they make so much on the ink.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sias

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: Followed the advice of a previous reviewer and just downloaded the drivers directly from the Canon website rather than use the included bloatware disk. Also be sure to unwrap the plastic ink cartridge holder and insert it BEFORE attempting to install the 5 ink cartridges. The wireless setup was easy. Just picked my network and entered my WPA password.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Darrell

customer_reviews.title: I think I'd be a lot less happy with it if I'd paid the $200+ it's going ...
customer_reviews.text: It still works well after 4 years. It is a lot slower than my old printer which can be frustrating when I'm printing directions and I'm running late. I paid about $100 dollars for it, I think I'd be a lot less happy with it if I'd paid the $200+ it's going for on some sites.
customer_reviews.author: A A Stone

customer_reviews.title: Good printer so far
customer_reviews.text: I don't print allot of stuff but when I need one I want one that is trouble free. This is my second Pixma and including the one I installed at my 82 year old Mom's house I now have experience with 3 (Canon Pixmas). 2 wired and one wireless. All installed on the first pass without issue and worked great. I'm familiar with computers but no expert so I was happy with the install. Ink setup seems a bit expensive but trouble free operation will make up for that.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L Dellarosa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Printer
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think a printer that was less than $100.00 could be this good but wow! Wireless set up was not to bad. You just gotta follow the steps to set up with your network. I have 3 laptops printing to it now. Scanning is not a problem. Press scan on the printer and it talks to your computer. I am very happy with this printer and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: INEXPENSIVE TO GET CARTRIDGES- YEAH!!!  and works well too
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Most printers make their money when you run out of ink and have to buy endless cartridges. You can get refilled cartridges here on AZ for a couple bucks each- amazing! Quality is great- only downside is that it is a little slow. The fact that I can get ink for it at a decent price and it has not konked out yet is well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Knight

customer_reviews.title: My third -- and last -- Canon printer
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three Canon printers over the years. Each has had a lifespan of around 36 months. My MP 560 has just served up the dreaded "B200" error (Google it before you buy one), which means that it will cost nearly as much to repair as to replace. This time, I'm going to look at Epsons and HPs. I have just wasted too much money on Canons. A $300 piece of electronics should be designed to live longer than a goldfish.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Weakley

customer_reviews.title: Canon wins again
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. So easy to set up it pretty much does it all by itself with a few clicks from you. We purchased this to replace our HP photosmart. We are so pleased it prints easy great quality pictures. It is quite large though. Also we did find it $10 cheaper at Wal-Mart a few days later but all in all we'd buy it again and we reccommend it!
customer_reviews.author: R. Warner

customer_reviews.title: Piece of cake
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry I read the reviews that said that I would have to track down the drivers for this printer. I am running this machine on a macbook pro with wifi. BAM....it was up and running no sweat, no problems. The speed of the machine depends upon how solid your wifi connection is. You will get alot of bang for your buck. Don't hesitate to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Great Muit-funtion Printer with low ink cost!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for almost a month and I love it! Great price and low ink cost for a multi-fuction printer. The only thing it does not do is fax, I do not have this need so it is great for me. Pros: great picture print quality, great overall print qaulity, two different paper tray opitions (tray and rear), wireless, front memory card slots, fast print speed once first item prints, and low cost ink. Cons: large footprint and slow to start up
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little printer
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be more satisfied and pleased with this printer. Very easy to get it setup on our WiFi network. As a test we took some recent photos we have had professionally printed and scanned them and printed them directly onto some of the sample photo paper that came with the printer. You couldn't tell which was which when we were finished. Very quiet and fast as well. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: K. Wren

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Ubuntu 10.04
customer_reviews.text: I have two systems at home that run Ubuntu Linux 10.04 and another laptop that runs Windows 7. Canon provided great support for Linux with the drivers available from [...] . It took me less time to setup the Linux systems than the Windows system. Prints great and I can also scan wirelessly using the open source Gimp tool! I am very pleased with the MP560!
customer_reviews.author: Luciano Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Lasted the Longest So far
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several printers, and this one has lasted the longest so far. I've moved it 3 times, and there has been no issue with it running phenomenally with all our electronics and it's initial setup. Note, the ink from Canon is WAY too pricey. But we buy generic ink of Amazon, and it seems to work great!
customer_reviews.author: littleladyblue

customer_reviews.title: I love my printer
customer_reviews.text: I've needed a printer for a very long time, but I was reluctant to purchase one, as I've been so disappointed in the past. This printer is so excellent, I wish I had purchased it much sooner than I did. In fact, my grandson bought one as he saw how wonderful mine worked and he loves his as much as I love mine. Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Veach

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted, expected from the description, and hoped was true about all the other reviews. It's pretty compact, not too heavy, and a snap to set up. My only problem is that it doesn't communicate SUPER fast with the wireless network, but ultimately that matters very little because it's wireless at all! :) I love this printer and I really can't believe it was so inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Wisker

customer_reviews.title: Similar to others, died too soon, very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This was a good printer when I bought it and it worked fine for casual home printing, although it always seemed like the ink cartridges ran out too soon. After a couple years of light/casual use, it started showing an error every time it was turned on and refused to allow any use. The error code (B200) appears to relate to the print head - which makes it particularly silly that you can't use the scanner or other functions outside of printing either. It is completely useless now and going in the trash. I would not recommend buying this item, and I also will stay away from other Canon inkjet printers in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Matt O

customer_reviews.title: Terrific little printer
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert on printers, but everything I read (and I read a lot) said that this Canon is the best out there for the money. I can only agree with those comments. This printer far exceeds my expectations, and the set-up was easy (go to the Canon website for the drivers for Mac - absolutely read Otto Olah's review in order to see how to do that).
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye Norman

customer_reviews.title: Super fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Super fast shipping. The price was good. It goes through ink pretty fast. It is slow. It uses 5 different ink cartridges so you can replace only what you need, but it won't print off it has an empty ink cartridge. If one of the colors is out i can't print in black and white.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA MP560 Wireless Inkjet All-In-One Photo Printer (3747B002)
product_meta.description:
The PIXMA MP560 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One perfectly blends performance and convenience. Its built-in two-sided printing can save you paper and help the environment so you can be efficient . The new Auto Photo Fix II feature automatically adjusts and helps to correct your photos and you can preview images before you print on its built-in 2.0” LCD. Plus, quickly access and select the function of your choice with the Easy Scroll Wheel. The Dual Color Gamut Processing Technology enables your copies to maintain the integrity of the original and Auto Scan Mode automatically recognizes the type of original you are scanning and saves it with the appropriate settings.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

At last – a compact, high-performance inkjet photo all-in-one with built-in Wireless and Auto Duplex Printing has arrived!! The PIXMA MP560 Inkjet Photo All-In-One Printer lets you easily print from anywhere around the house enjoying incredible 9600 x 2400 maximum color dpi1 with a minimum color droplet size of 1pl and a 5 individual ink tank system. So, you can print beautiful borderless photos up to 8.5” x 11” or crisp, clean documents and enjoy incredible quality.


Print from anywhere in the house quickly and easily!View larger
The PIXMA MP560 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One perfectly blends performance and convenience. Its built-in two-sided printing can save you paper and help the environment so you can be efficient all the time. The new Auto Photo Fix II feature automatically adjusts and helps to correct your photos and you can preview images before you print on its built-in 2.0” LCD. Plus, quickly access and select the function of your choice with the Easy Scroll Wheel. Making copies? No problem. Dual Color Gamut Processing Technology enables your copies to maintain the integrity of the original. For the scanner in you, Auto Scan Mode2 automatically recognizes the type of original you are scanning and saves it with the appropriate settings.


For added versatility, enjoy computer-free photo printing options via compatible memory cards3, USB Flash Memory Drives4, PictBridge and optional Bluetooth devices5.




For the 7th year in a row, Canon U.S.A. is proud to have received the 2010 Readers' Choice Award for Service & Reliability from PCMag.com for Printers


Logos are trademarks of Ziff Davis, Inc. Used under license.
Reprinted from www.pcmag.com, September 7, 2010, with permission. © 2010 Ziff Davis, Inc. All Rights Reserved.


Speed & Quality
Extraordinary Resolution: Realize the power of 9600 x 2400 maximum color dpi1 firing with a minimum color droplet size of 1pl. The benefit? Incredible quality and detail in both your photos and documents.

High Performance Individual Ink System: This 5-color ink system consists of four dye-based inks plus a pigment-based black ink, producing exceptional photos and crisp, laser-quality text. So, you only replace the color ink tank that runs out...saving you money on ink!

ChromaLife100+:This system combines enhanced FINE print head technology with select genuine Canon photo papers and inks for beautiful borderless photos that will last up to 300 years6 when stored in an archival-quality photo album. 

Print high quality pictures easily and quickly.View larger Ease of Use
Keep It Green: Built-in 2-sided printing can cut your paper usage by 50%, helping the environment.

2.0” LCD Screen:Easily view, select and edit your images for simple computer-free printing. No downloading needed, just pick your pic and print!

Auto Photo Fix II: This built-in technology automatically categorizes your images into one of five types - Portrait, Scenery, Night Scenery, Snapshot with Scenery, and Snapshot with Night Scenery - then applies optimal image and multi-zone exposure correction. So, unexposed areas of the photo will be optimized, area by area and faces that are backlit and under-exposed will automatically be brightened with correct color cast to help ensure more accurate skin tones for gorgeous images.

Easy Scroll Wheel: Easily and quickly access and select the various features available for faster operation. 

Auto Scan Mode2: Automatically recognizes the type of original you are scanning and saves it with the appropriate settings. 

Quick Start: Powering up your printer is now faster than ever. After pressing the power button you can begin inputting commands in mere seconds. So, full operation is possible in a much shorter time.

2 Way Paper Feeding: To add to your options this feature lets you load paper from the front cassette or rear tray so whether your office or photo lab is open, you’re ready to print! 

Dual Color Gamut Technology: Copy with confidence as this built-in technology automatically optimizes your copy quality based on the type of original you’re copying to help your copies stay true to it.

Built-in two-sided printing can save you paper and help the environment.View larger Connectivity
Wireless: Be free of the wires that bind you… Print and scan wirelessly7 from any Wi-Fi enabled computer while you’re in another room and create a wireless network with multiple computers working from one PIXMA MP560 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One Printer.

USB Flash Memory/Memory Cards / PictBridge & Optional Bluetooth: Don’t feel like using a computer? No problem. Just insert your compatible memory card3 into the built-in card slot, select images on the LCD display, and print! Thanks to a PictBridge connection you can also print photos directly from your USB Flash Memory Drive4, digital camera, DV camcorder or camera phone5,8. Plus, you can print from a Bluetooth-enabled device using the optional BU-30 wireless Bluetooth unit5. 


Print and scan wirelessly even when you're in another room!View larger Features

Maximum print resolution:
Realizes the maximum print resolution of 9600 x 2400 dpi. Provides premium photo quality, combined with microscopic ink droplets. 

Minimum ink droplet size:
High-density FINE print head technology has enabled miniscule ink drop injection with a minimum size of 1pl (one trillionth of a liter). 

Individual ink tanks that use all colors without waste:
The use of highly accurate optical detection function to inform you how much ink is left and LEDs to notify you if the ink tanks are not mounted properly and when the ink is running out. 

Photo printing speed:
Thanks to improvement of FINE print head and paper feeding mechanisms, photo lab quality print can be delivered at high speed, at default setting. 

Scanner Optical Resolution:
The highest level at which the scanner used in all-in-one models can perform, measured in dots per inch. 

ChromaLife100+:
The combination of new inks and new media deliver improved quality and longevity in your prints as well as increased color range, especially in the reds. 

LCD display size:
Easily view, select and edit your images for convenient computer-free printing. 

Auto Duplex Print:
This built-in feature allows you to automatically print on both sides of the paper - it's hands free! 

2-Way Paper Feed:
2-Way Paper Feeding is possible from both the Rear tray and the Cassette to reduce the amount of time required for changing paper types. 

Clear and Intuitive Operation:
Users can easily select and manipulate various functions. 

D.C.G. Processing Technology:
Automatically optimize copy quality based on the type of originals you are copying. 

Auto Photo Fix II:
This versatile Canon software will analyze your photo and apply optimal image correction, plus automatic red-eye removal for beautiful results with just the click of the mouse. 

Borderless Printing:
Borderless printing is possible on a wide variety of paper sizes and types. 

Quick Start:
"Quick Start" refers to the seconds required between pressing the power key and the key operations become ready. 

Wi-Fi:
Print wirelessly from a Wi-Fi enabled computer while you're in another room. 

Memory Card Slots:
Digital photographs can be printed quickly and easily simply by inserting memory cards into the card slots. 

Camera Phone Printing:
Snap and print wirelessly right from your PictBridge enabled mobile camera phone. 

PictBridge:
Print photos by connecting a cable from PIXMA printer to a PictBridge compliant digital camera, digital camcorder or mobile phone. Compliant with the PictBridge industry standard. 

Optional Bluetooth:
Short range wireless protocol that allows compatible devices to wirelessly transmit data to another. 

USB 2.0 Hi-Speed:
Faster data - The USB 2.0 interface enables the fastest possible image transfer.

"Oh, I'll just print only in black-only grayscale" you say? Nope. If one ink goes, for whatever reason it decides, it won't let you print anything. "Well in that case, I'll use refurbished cartridges off of EBay" you say? For a little while these do actually seem to work. You can get exponentially more ink for fractions of the cost. For me, they tended to work for several months before the printer started rejecting them at random, one at a time, it was pretty weird, almost as if it learned.... creepy. Also stock-piling bulk ink doesn't work either, they have an expiration date coded into them. Yeah, the amount of thought put into scamming the consumer on this stuff is pretty criminal. Even if it did work as advertised and the ink thing didn't infuriate you and your wallet so much, it still prints very slow. Give it a few minutes to warm up and make a bunch of noise, then hopefully, if it doesn't declare an ink cartridge unfit for duty, doesn't throw a network error, or stays "warming up" forever (yeah, that happens too) it might decide to oblige.

Too many experiences just like this that end in a scene out of Office Space.Read more 9 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse Nick5.0 out of 5 stars Nice printer, nice scanner, great for novice usersReviewed in the United States on October 22, 2009Verified Purchase This printer was purchased as a birthday present for my mother, who has been hampered by a Windows Vista computer and a malfunctioning HP Printer (it worked great with XP...). We purchased the Canon PIXMA MP560 printer for $85 (free shipping) on Amazon, and comparing the price to other retailers online (and the retail price), it was no contest.

This printer has some features that you may already know of via the product description page, but I'd like to elaborate on some of these features.
Thoughts out of the box:
-The MP560 has a folding LCD screen that covers the function buttons. The screen is not too large, but it does seem to have large enough text (and a simple GUI) to work well for novice printer users. There are not too many buttons, and they're large, well-marked, and simple enough for anyone to recognize.
-The printer has a lower paper tray (for regular inkjet/copier paper) and an upper vertical tray (for thicker photo paper and other things). The vertical tray has an automatic two-sided width adjustment/alignment, so any size paper is aligned to the proper position every time (and the thickness is adjustable from maximum printing width of the printer, down to only an inch or so).
-The basic instruction manual is printed on paper, and easily guided me through the process of installation of the print head/ink, paper, software, and wireless network capability. This guide has simple words and illustrations, though it does not include every detail of the printer's operations (the more complex instruction/user manual is electronic, and is installed with the printer software). There is a Network Troubleshooting guide, as well, that seems to be rather detailed (though unnecessary in my case). The printer comes with a sample pack of 4"x6" photo paper, which we immediately tested (and it passed the test with flying colors). There's other throw-away junk included, but nothing that surprising.
-The printer is clearly labeled so as to make it simple to place cartridges in the right location, once the print head is installed.
-The fact that the MP560 has multiple single-color ink cartridges may seem expensive at first, but with tri-color cartridge printers, we would always seem to run out of a single color much faster than other colors... so we were wasting a good amount of ink each and every time we replaced a cartridge. This printer seems to have ink cartridges that would be easier to refill than some other cartridges, as well.

After powering it on:
-It was EFFORTLESS to set up the MP560 on our wireless network. It quickly detected the network (our router is on another floor in the house, on the other side of the house), and it still had a good quality signal, and it only took a few minutes (and only a couple pushes of a button... plus entering our internet security key) before the printer was connected. There is a rotating pad (similar to an IPod) on the printer that lets you select any security codes you may have (and navigate through the GUI)... so it may take awhile if one has an alphanumeric password, but it was rather quick for a numeric 8-key code. Heck, my mom is not too familiar with computers, and I have no doubts that she could have set up this printer with the network.
-The printer comes with easy to use software (again, in Vista), though it does take a few minutes for the software to install itself on a PC. The basic instruction manual makes it rather easy to install everything, whether using Windows or Mac. Once installed, the printer is rather effortlessly found (remember to have attached the printer to the wireless network), and before you know it, you're ready to print.
-The printer has a laser ink level meter for every cartridge, and it can be displayed on the computer and on the 2" LCD screen on the printer (actually, pressing one button on the "Home" screen will allow you to see each ink level). So far, it does not appear as if this printer over-uses ink... in fact, printing on glossy photo paper seems to suggest there's less "gunk" on the paper than some other printers, perhaps due to the finer ink jets this printer allegedly uses.

Using the printer for the first time:
-The printer and software actually WORK WELL with Windows Vista!
-The printer does take a few seconds to warm up, but after the first print job, it seems to be much faster.
-The MP560 didn't have a single problem feeding thicker photo paper.
-The quality of printed pictures is very good, showing very tight pixels even on plain paper. Photo paper shows an excellent picture quality, and the software included with the printer makes it effortless to print photos with certain photo papers... no need to change printer settings manually.
-The scanner/copier seems to produce quality pictures, although this isn't the fastest, nor the quietest, copier I've seen in a multi-use printer.
-The Duplex printing feature is a great thing to have in a lower-cost home printer, as few documents are of an official, legal nature, hence there's no need for one-sided printing. It gets to be inconvenient to flip the pages by hand each and every time one wants to print on both sides of a piece of paper, so it is great to find a lower-cost printer that has this feature. This printer does not print internally, it prints on one side and extracts the page, then gathers the page back inside the printer and prints on the other side, so I don't know how well Duplex printing would work on thicker media such as fabrics.

All in all, this is a great printer so far. It beats anything I've ever owned, in terms of print quality and functionality, and I'd say it's a pretty good value to boot. Mom is certainly happy about this printer, and she's going to test it with some of her crafts... let's see how it stands up to the test of time when she puts it to use.Read more 389 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse See all reviews from the United States
